{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3358478,"name":"Frank","username":"AlligatorFan3","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/f17d59/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-11T04:18:00.902Z","cooked":"

Over offseason (and next build season) I want to add more features to our robot, ranging from literally anything, as long as it has a benefit. At this point I feel like ive added everything I can, and it kind of feels there is a lot more I can add to my code but I cant really think of anything. I’ve done Game Piece detection, apriltags, LEDs, PPIDs, Feedforwards, pathplanner, etc.

Currently my only plans for the summer is to learn how to log better with AdvantageKit and learning how to utilize glass and sysID more. I was wondering what things other teams have done to improve their code, big or small

Just throwing a few things I have heard of.

Shooting on the move
Advanced control such as Kalman filter and lqr
Auto PID tuning
Robot detection and avoidance
Automatic defense
And probably a bunch more …

I would suggest trying to watch some teams behind the bumpers and seeing what cool features they have.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-11T04:29:00.926Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":357,"readers_count":356,"score":96.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":462181,"topic_slug":"what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62573,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3075 Code Lead"},"post_url":"/t/what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code/462181/2","custom_user_title":"3075 Code Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3358484,"name":"Reza","username":"Rezq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rezq/{size}/178141_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-11T04:29:41.583Z","cooked":"

How’s the consistency of your robot and all of these features? I don’t know your team or how consistent it is but personally, once I have a lot of features I start working on making everything robust, reliable, and easy to use. Another nice thing you could work on is training and helping more students get up to speed with your code so it can keep improving over the years, even after you leave.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-11T04:29:41.583Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":322,"readers_count":321,"score":64.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":462181,"topic_slug":"what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code","display_username":"Reza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50815,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1622 | Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code/462181/3","custom_user_title":"1622 | Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3358495,"name":"Dylan","username":"dylan292","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dylan292/{size}/168044_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-11T05:14:00.503Z","cooked":"

A small thing we did this year, but has been pretty helpful, is adding rumble/vibration feedback for our driver and operator.

Our driver’s controller vibrates when a note is inside the robot.

Our operator’s controller vibrates when there is less than 30 seconds left in a match. (So they know when to go climb)

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-11T13:25:03.576Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462181,"topic_slug":"what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51481,"username":"dylan292","name":"Dylan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dylan292/{size}/168044_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code/462181/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3358666,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-11T13:31:21.544Z","cooked":"

@brandonmcd does the “murder button” count as a feature? It wasn’t designed to be a murder button, but that’s what it was called after it didn’t work right.

If it had worked as expected it would’ve been great, but with odometry/pose drift it was deadly to the commons area tile where we practice.

Brandon can better explain what was supposed to happen, but what did happen was the driver pressed a button for an untested feature. The robot immediately starting driving sideways, smacked into a table and the table broke 2 moulding tiles near the floor.

From what I understand the goal of the feature was to make the robot generate a safe trajectory between where the robot currently is on the field and make it automatically move and rotate to a specific pose near the speaker while the button was held. If they let go it would cancel and abort the move. This would make it much easier on the driver/operator to line up each time and not need to focus on driving and start scoping out their next open piece in the field. While the driver is focused on that the operator can get the shooter up to speed and wait for the perfect alignment when the command ends on its own and flashed a light.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-11T13:31:57.470Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":174,"readers_count":173,"score":59.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":462181,"topic_slug":"what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code/462181/9","custom_user_title":"Mr. Siefen","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3358717,"name":"","username":"KfirNeuman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-11T14:17:54.209Z","cooked":"

This isn’t something we currently have but plan to look into in the off-season. There are algorithms online which are used for things which cannot be tuned effectively at production and need to tune themselves. The simplest method would be to do linear regression to find a good kP and then add kD if there are oscillation and add kI based on the steady state error. I can find some essays I found on the topic if you want.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-11T14:17:54.209Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":156,"readers_count":155,"score":51.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":462181,"topic_slug":"what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":54172,"username":"JaiCodes","name":"Jainish Patel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaicodes/{size}/203987_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62573,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3075 Code Lead"},"post_url":"/t/what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code/462181/10","custom_user_title":"3075 Code Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3358790,"name":"","username":"KfirNeuman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-11T15:02:55.690Z","cooked":"

For the autotuning see my post above.

Kalman filter and LQR are 2 topics which use a mathematical model of your system. The mathematical model is based on the fact that if you know the current state of the system and the inputs to the system you can predict where the system will be in the future.

The Kalman filter merges the mathematical model with measurements from sensors to give a better prediction of the current state of the system.

LQR uses the mathematical model to find the optimal inputs to get from state A to state B. It’s advantage over PID is that unlike PID where you guess gains through trial and error, LQR uses a mathematical model which can be defined without a physical system. The other advantage is that it outputs the optimal inputs to go between the two states.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-11T15:03:46.394Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":142,"readers_count":141,"score":53.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":462181,"topic_slug":"what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":20003,"username":"joemost","name":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62573,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3075 Code Lead"},"post_url":"/t/what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code/462181/11","custom_user_title":"3075 Code Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3358868,"name":"Eric (319)","username":"EKM_319","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ekm_319/{size}/230932_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-11T15:50:19.388Z","cooked":"

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-11T15:50:19.388Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":24.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462181,"topic_slug":"what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code","display_username":"Eric (319)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":62573,"username":"KfirNeuman","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23786,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Awaiting our Robot Overlords since 2013"},"post_url":"/t/what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code/462181/12","custom_user_title":"Awaiting our Robot Overlords since 2013","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3358883,"name":"Brandon McDonald","username":"brandonmcd","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/48db29/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-11T15:56:51.549Z","cooked":"

Work on path planner if you haven’t, it’s such a huge advantage and has so much extra you can do with it.

kingc95:

does the “murder button” count as a feature?

Our team attempted to use path planner to create on the fly trajectories, but we didn’t have vision or a stop button so it was just murder button.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-11T15:56:51.549Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":22.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":462181,"topic_slug":"what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code","display_username":"Brandon McDonald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FAMNM President"},"post_url":"/t/what-major-or-minor-features-have-you-added-to-tour-code/462181/13","custom_user_title":"FAMNM President","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3358952,"name":"MrNick","username":"MrNick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrnick/{size}/8269_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-11T17:04:55.074Z","cooked":"

Perhaps my suggestion is on the minor side, but I’m a firm believer that minor positive changes often have large positive impacts. With that in mind, I would suggest working on disabled robot capabilities. With sensors and lights, there is lots of information the robot can convey about its condition while disabled. Ours goes through a series of checks, color coded to the system that is being checked. That has been helpful in rapidly diagnosing failures by pointing to the subsystem that is having trouble. We also implemented a robot gesture to toggle coast and brake mode. By spinning the indexer motors out and then in, our climber and elevator are put into coast mode. Light changes indicate the mode switch. That was an easy coding change that was a big quality of life improvement for our pit crew.

Here is our implementation of it. To be perfectly honest, I don’t like how I created it, but it was more of a last minute addition (but it works).

In my command that I use to rev the shooter if a note is in the robot, I have it call a function that rumbles the controller in RobotContainer and has it stop rumbling if a note is not in the robot.

github.com

panthertech292/2024_r/blob/31e2f91877f0c1898f0d27b6d4b97f1e34eb316e/src/main/java/frc/robot/commands/Shooter/ShooterRunRev.java#L45


      
    
          
  1. // Called when the command is initially scheduled.
    2. 
          
  2. @Override
    3. 
          
  3. public void initialize() {}
    4. 
          
  4. 
          
  5. // Called every time the scheduler runs while the command is scheduled.
    6. 
          
  6. @Override
    7. 
          
  7. public void execute() {
    8. 
          
  8.   //If there is a note loaded and our rev speed is greater than the input speed, run at rev speed
    9. 
          
  9.   if(ShooterSub.getFeedBeltSwitch() && (this.shooterSpeed.getAsDouble() < ShooterConstants.kRevSpeed)){
    10. 
          
  10.     ShooterSub.setShooter(ShooterConstants.kRevSpeed);
    11. 
          
  11.     RobotContainer.setRightRumbleDriver(0.25);
    12. 
          
  12.     LEDSub.blinkSolidColor(0, 255, 0);
    13. 
          
  13.   }else{
    14. 
          
  14.     ShooterSub.setShooter(this.shooterSpeed.getAsDouble());
    15. 
          
  15.     RobotContainer.setRightRumbleDriver(0.0);
    16. 
          
  16.     if(SwerveSub.isAllianceBlue()){
    17. 
          
  17.       LEDSub.setColorChase(120, 60, SwerveSub.getVelocity()*5);
    18. 
          
  18.     }else{
    19. 
          
  19.       LEDSub.setColorChase(60, 120, SwerveSub.getVelocity()*5);
    20. 
          
  20.     }
    21. 
          
  21.     
    22.

This is the function I use to set the rumble. I’m not really sure if having this as a static method and the controllers as static objects (so I can rumble them) is the best way to do this, but I’m not sure on any other way to do this.
